page.title: 18PEOPLE IN EAST MERSEA
page.content: In a survey of 55 households in East Mersea the average length of residence was calculated at 15 years. 3 people had been resident for more than 60 years(the longest recorded was 65 years) and a third of the sample had been resident for 20 years or more. Only 6% had moved in within the last year the same percentage as in the 1981 census. The dilemna of living in rural areas was also revealed by this survey.Some 58% of those interviewed considered peace and quiet the most attractive aspect of East Mersea. A further 14% liked the countryside or the sea. However 30% said the lack of transport,particularly the bus-service was the biggest disadvantage.Other problems mentioned were the isolation, adverse weather in winter and few entertainments for young children.
